alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 9:27AM CST until January 30 at 9:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Comite River At Comite Joor Rd affecting East Baton Rouge Parish. For the Amite And Comite Rivers...including Olive Branch, Comite Joor Rd, Darlington, Grangeville, Magnolia, Denham Springs, Bayou Manchac Point, Bayou Manchac Near Little Prairie, Port Vincent, French Settlement, Maurepas...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Comite River At Comite Joor Rd. * WHEN...From this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, High water will prevent recreational and industrial activity from Louisiana Highway 64 downstream to the Amite River junction. Farm animals and equipment should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CST Monday the stage was 20.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CST Monday was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.5 feet on 12/08/1971. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
